clean cooking.Description: Clean cooking often involves the use of biomass fuels like wood, crop residues, and animal dung.
Clean cooking can be achieved through the utilization of solar cookers and solar-powered stoves.
Clean cooking can be achieved by using LPG (liquefied petroleum gas) as a fuel source, which produces fewer emissions compared to traditional fuels.
Clean cooking often involves the use of improved cookstoves that are designed to burn fuel more efficiently and reduce harmful emissions.
